climbs.name: Southern Satisfaction
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough Equipped by Patrick Miller

content.description: Start just right of End of State Maintenance. Some big moves to good holds lead to a ledge. Pull the final bulge on big holds to an anchor at the lip.
In the right side of the nursery, this route ascends the massive roof you pass as you head up the trail towards the cliff line.
content.protection: 8 bolts, but a few are permadraws.
content.location: From the trail split head right, past the teepee as the trail heads back toward the cliff line, the route starts underneath the large and obvious roof.

content.description: Bouldery start into good jugs some good rests then thins out at the top
Mantel up to a ledge then fight the pump on a slightly overhanging face
content.location: Where the trail meets the cliff, this is the left of three sport climbs starting on a ledge above

content.description: Climb up between Hazy Dazy and a hueco. (This is the second route from the left on the slab wall.)

Starts 20 feet left of Solomon Grundy. Work your way up through some easy ledge climbing to a stance below the first bolt. Moderate climbing on solid edges and pockets takes you to a rest before the roof before the steep headwall. When ready, make a move to gain the roof and get ready to pull hard. Choosing pockets wisely may be the difference between sending or not. Rock quality on this is significantly better than it's neighbor to the right.
content.location: The Left of the two routes on an overhanging face to the left of the Nursery slab wall.

content.description: Climb up to a larger horizontal ledge then cruise up the slab, passing another horizontal, then all the way to the chains.
content.location: Right-most route on the Nursery's slab wall. Just to the right of Kate's Way.

content.description: Climb up the slab, passing a hueco on the left. Continue through a tricky/technical sequence (or just reach through) and finish at the chains.
content.location: On the Nursery's slab wall. Second to last route on the right side of the wall, just before Kentucky Two Step (right-most route).

content.description: The far left route on the slab. (Slab is located right of the overhang containing Solomon Grundy.)
Bouldery moves and underclings down low lead to a rest and a mellower finish as the bolts become more spaced.

climbs.name: Fuzzy Muffin
climbs.fa: First Ascent: Bob Bartlett, Patrick Miller in 2014

content.description: Third route from the left on the slab wall (next to Pixadoodle). Climb up and into a hueco; getting above the hueco is the crux.
Angle right a bit through large holds then deal with a hard 11d+ section.
content.location: Where the trail meets the cliff look for a ledge above for the start

content.description: Start on the overhung face and get your money's worth for the grade in the first 10 feet. Recommend stick clipping the first bolt if you're not solid on 11s. After that just pumpy and fun moves to the chains.
content.location: Formerly the rightmost route at the nursery, two routes have since been added. Head right from the trail split, up and over to the slab wall, and around the arete.

content.description: start just right of kentucky two step. Climb up some leadges to a tricky spot. As with most of the slab routes the ability to highstep and mantel will make this one easy.

If you're up for a bit of adventure climbing and you lugged your trad rack to Nursery, this is the route for you. Some of the moves require a bit of faith but the gear and holds are all there. Prepare to get a little dirty. When we told someone our plan was to clean and FA this route, they remarked, "You can't polish a turd." Well, it turns out you can.
content.protection: a few C3s and small cams, nuts and singles up to a 3.
content.location: About 30 feet right of "End of State Maintenance" starting in the crack across from the large tree. There is tat and a ring around the tree at the top, or you can scramble up the dirty slope to find a trail you can walk down.
